senses.sense_definition: The upper moulding or border of a pedestal, baseboard, or similar architectural structure.

examples.text: The carpenter carefully restored the intricate <w>surbase</w> of the antique column.
Dust tends to accumulate on the <w>surbase</w> just above the flat panel.

senses.sense_definition: To reduce the vertical height or rise of an arch.

examples.text: The architect decided to <w>surbase</w> the arch to accommodate the low ceiling.
They had to <w>surbase</w> the vaulting during the renovation of the tunnel.
